description: From be- +‎ deck. Compare West Frisian bedekke (“to cover”), Dutch bedekken (“to cover, coat, overlay”), German bedecken (“to cover, top, overlay”), Swedish betäcka (“to cover, shelter”). Doublet of bethatch.

verbs.description: bedeck (third-person singular simple present bedecks, present participle bedecking, simple past and past participle bedecked)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To deck, ornament, or adorn; to grace.
examples: She bedecked her wedding gown with seed pearls.
